cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the analysis of diversity systems, which are commonly used in communication systems. The paper discusses the level crossing rate and average fade duration of the output signal-to-noise ratio in switch-and-stay combining systems. These are important performance metrics in communication systems, and hence, the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT), Communications (cs.COMM), and Systems and Control (cs.SY) categories. The paper also discusses the use of threshold-based techniques such as decode-and-forward relays, which are commonly used in wireless networks, and hence, the paper may also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) category. Finally, the paper uses probability density functions to analyze the higher order statistics, which is a common technique in the Mathematics (cs.MA) category.
